About reviews...
How are those checklist format reviews helpful at all? I keep seeing more and more of them pop up and they keep getting to the top of store pages as "most helpful" when they really don't say anything. Here is an example:

---{ Graphics }---
‚òê You forget what reality is
‚òê Beautiful
‚òê Good
‚òê Decent
‚òë Bad
‚òê Don‚Äòt look too long at it
‚òê MS-DOS

‚òê Mehh
‚òê Watch paint dry instead
‚òê Just don't

---{ Audio }---
‚òê Eargasm
‚òê Very good

‚òë Not too bad
‚òê Bad
‚òê I'm now deaf

---{ ? / 10 }---
‚òê 1

‚òê 3

‚òë 5
‚òê 6
‚òê 7
‚òê 8
‚òê 9
‚òê 10


Based on the information provided, can you guess what game this review is for? What's it about? What kind of game is it?

Point is, these reviews are completely interchangeable. I bet if you took this exact review, and copy and pasted it to every game in your library, you'd get the top review for half of the games you put it on, even if you didn't change the check marks to fit each individual game.

In my opinion, the Steam community should stop encouraging this format and instead downvote them all into oblivion. Maybe it's just me, and I guess it's not THAT big a deal, but for someone that puts at least some effort into the reviews they write, it is a little disheartening that the steam community prefers lazy checklists that ultimately don't say anything specific about the games in question. Plus I don't see how they could ever actually influence someone's decision to purchase a game or not when so little information is given.

Anyone agree or am I the only one that wants to read legitimately helpful reviews for games I might be interested in?

10/10 game, you are guaranteed to be a baby bitch boi male angler fish anisodon lookin ass at first in the game, but its gameplay is quite unique in the sense that ive never encountered a game that requires such a weird play style, nor could i think of how someone would think of the idea to make such a weird ass combat system, without being a science experiment born outve a test tube specifically to produce a game nobody else could think of. If you wanna play ricochet feel free to add me. Its a genuinely unique and fun game that im not sure ill ever 100% understand or get the hang of, but id play any day of the week given im not busy.

Muerto como mis esperanzas.

There wasn't a single server open with even a single-player, hell there weren't even any server options to begin with so I couldn't even join an empty one. I tried out the three maps the game has to offer by creating a custom server and the gameplay got stale after about 10 seconds. If there is ever a definition for a dead game, this is it.

Unfortunately Ricochet is a mostly dead game now with minimal people ever online to get matchmaking working so I unfortunately cannot recommend this game to anyone.

However, I will say that when Ricochet was at its peak it was one of the wackiest multiplayer games ever and was an absolute blast. Hopefully one day Valve will release a Ricochet 2 but unfortunately in 2021 this game is not worth playing.

Half-Life

This game is dead by now. The gameplay contains not much interest. Fighting in mid-air arena filled with a number of hovering platforms which allow players to jump from one to another, contestants throw disc-like weapon against each other to knock them off the platform and fall to death for score. Not interesting at all.

Unlike Counter-strike, Team Fortress and Portal, this Half-Life offspring did not receive enough popularity to continue the franchise. Just being another unsuccessful product.

It's Richochet I kinda wish there was a Neutral Review point cause I can't discourage trying it but I also can't recommend it if you don't already own it. Just to give a breif summary you play on floating platforms where the goal is generally to push other players off. You only shoot forward and you can grab power ups for your discs.
